lexUnit.name: piece together.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assemble something from individual parts

sentence.text: They should come forward and let us piece together the jigsaw . ”
They would then take it in turns to piece together each others jigsaw , guaranteed to keep them happy for years .
She handed him the two parts of the torch and waited for him to piece the thing together .
Mr Chad explained how Harris had tried to burn the envelope but police had later pieced it together .
He took Mould to the room without any floorboards , and helped him piece together a bizarre contraption containing metal beams , weights and cogs .
They 're anthology pieces , piecing together things which have appeared in smaller works . "
Recovery operations continued and hundreds of items were finally brought to the surface so that the plane could be painstakingly pieced back together again .
To the dismay of record-collectors , it now became possible to piece together a collection of imperfect bits to make a complete note-perfect performance .
These are constructed by piecing together cuttings of plain coloured fusion bonded pieces or strips , a speciality of Stoddard Mattor .
Mr Chad explained how Harris had tried to burn the envelope but police had later pieced it together .
However , since you have no doubt spent hours piecing this letter together ( must have taken you hours , my dear , to get all those words out ) -- I 'll grudgingly acknowledge its existence .

As the words of a sentence are being recognised , using their orthographic structure , their sentence context or whatever , then they must be pieced together to reconstruct the underlying meaning of the sentence .
He took Mould to the room without any floorboards , and helped him piece together a bizarre contraption containing metal beams , weights and cogs .
Some , like Deutsche Bank and Crédit Lyonnais , are piecing together hugely expensive pan-European bank networks in the firm belief that retail banking can be moved across borders .
